overview: Reza Zadno recently joined New Leaf Venture Partners. Prior to joining New Leaf, Reza was the Founder, President, and CEO of Visiogen, Inc. which has developed an accommodating intra-ocular lens to treat cataract and presbyopia. Visiogen was acquired by Abbott-Medical Optics in 2009. He was previously at Three Arch Partners working as Entrepreneur-in-Residence where he founded Visiogen. Prior to joining Three Arch, he had co-founded PercuSurge, Inc. in 1995. Percusurge pioneered the field of distal protection devices that provide treatment of occluded carotid arteries and saphenous vein grafts. Medtronic acquired PercuSurge in 2000. Prior to PercuSurge, Reza was with Cardiac Pathways Corp. from the companyâ€™s early inception in the Advanced Development Group. Cardiac Pathways markets mapping and ablation systems for the treatment of arrhythmia (acquired by Boston Scientific in 2001). Reza started his career at Raychem Corporation, now Tyco, after receiving his Ph.D. from Ecole des Mines de Paris.
